results.title: The Noisy underwater world of the Weddell seal
results.creator_credit: William L. Claiborne and William Claiborne Incorporated
results.brief_description: Shows the Weddell seal under Antarctic ice and reports on the strange sounds of the seal as picked up on hydrophones by a team of biologists and bio-accousticians. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Noise invasion
results.brief_description: Fascinating exploration of the deleterious effects to health of excessive environmental noise. This noise is traced to its principal sources - in transport and industry - and technological and legislative approaches for its reduction are examined. Points out that industrial noise is causing permanent deafness in millions of people and shows the results of research.

results.title: The Nineties
results.creator_credit: Monique Oomen, Vincent Burke and TopShelf Productions
results.brief_description: In 1893 New Zealand women were the first in the world to achieve the right to vote. One hundred years later, “The Nineties” looks at the lives of seven women - Madge Wallscott, Kuini Te Tau, Sister Eustace, Grace Patterson, Ellen Hopkins, Minnie Martin and Margaret Dean - all in their nineties and full of vitality, who have lived through the changes of the last century. With the use of rare photographs and archival film footage, this documentary is a piece of women’s history, of universal appeal, telling of the hardship and struggles, determination and achievements of these women. Their lives and stories tell of their family background, their teenage years, marriage, children, the Depression years, World War II, their involvement in community work and finally, their ‘nineties’. This documentary celebrates the extraordinary lives of these women. Interviewer: Monique Oomen.

results.title: The Nine bad shots of golf
results.brief_description: Experts analyse all the major golf faults; nine bad shots are demonstrated; experts show exactly how to correct each one in a series of straight action, slow motion and stop motion sequences.

results.title: The Nile in Egypt
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Gateway Educational Films
results.brief_description: For centuries the waters of the Nile have brought fertility to Egypt, and served as a vital artery of transportation. Shows the marked contrast between ancient methods of irrigation and more modern developments. Most recent project is the high dam at Aswan which will greatly increase hydroelectric power, control flooding and create a huge area of additional farmland.

results.title: The Nights Belong to the Novelist: the Imaginitive World of Elizabeth Jolley, Australian Writer
results.brief_description: This program is a warm, humorous and thoroughly engaging look at one of Australia’s prominent contemporary writers. Elizabeth Jolley discusses her writing, and talks about how she develops her characters and stories. The film utilises selected dramatised sequences throughout, to highlight the nuances and creativity of Jolley’s works.

results.title: The Nightlight
results.creator_credit: Cathrine McVeigh, University of Melbourne and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Set in the early 1950’s this is a moving story of a relationship between a grandfather,’Pop’ who was a soldier in the Lighthorse Brigade during the first World War, and who now is a lighthouse keeper in a very remote and isolated part of Victoria, and his young visiting grandson, Ryan (aged around 12-13 year’s old). Pop appears to be immersed in the memories of the war, the horror and tragedies haunting him continually. He and Ryan engage in war games which become increasingly disturbing for Ryan and his relationship with his grandfather. Filmed in black and white, the lighthouse takes on an almost surreal aspect adding to the haunting mood of this rather tragic tale. Shot on location in Portland and Cape Nelson Lightstation. Cast includes Harold Hopkins, Zach Meyers and Penny Larkins.

results.title: The Night of Saint Lawrence = La Notte di San Lorenzo
results.creator_credit: Paolo Taviani, Vittorio Taviani, Giuliani De Negri, Ager Cinematografica and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Cover title: “The Night of the shooting stars.” The villagers of San Martino, Tuscany wish upon shooting stars during the Feast of San Lorenzo. It is August 10, 1944 and there is much to wish for. The Germans are retreating. The Blackshirts, still loyal to The Duce, are sweeping the countryside with kamakaze ferocity. The American GI’s may arrive tomorrow, or never. An extraordinarly touching, involving, richly textured World War II drama of the final days of World War II prior to liberation by U.S. troops. With simple, lyrical but rivetting images, the filmmakers unravel a life-affirming story of war’s absurdities, heroic spirit, hope and survival. Winner Special Prize, Cannes Film Festival. Starring Omero Antonutti and Margarita Lozano. Co-starring Claudio Bigagli, Massimo Bonetti, Norma Martelli, Enrica Maria Modugno and Sabina Vannucchi. Italian dialogue with English subtitles.
